data.chText: 亲密的；密切的
data.enText: having a close and friendly relationship

data.chText: 密友
data.enText: intimate friends

data.chText: 我们和邻居来往不多。
data.enText: We're not on intimate terms with our neighbours.

data.chText: 个人隐私的（常指性方面的）
data.enText: private and personal, often in a sexual way

data.chText: 文章披露了他的家庭生活中的隐私。
data.enText: The article revealed intimate details about his family life.

data.chText: 她的身体的最隐私部位
data.enText: the most intimate parts of her body

data.chText: 宜于密切关系的；温馨的；便于有性关系的
data.enText: encouraging close, friendly relationships, sometimes of a sexual nature

data.chText: 幽静温馨的餐厅
data.enText: an intimate restaurant

data.chText: 他知道一处适合幽会的小酒吧，他们在那里不会受到打扰。
data.enText: He knew an intimate little bar where they would not be disturbed.

data.chText: 详尽的；精通的
data.enText: very detailed and thorough

data.chText: 对英格兰乡村的透彻了解
data.enText: an intimate knowledge of the English countryside

data.chText: 密切的；紧密的
data.enText: very close

data.chText: 社会阶层和优良教育之间的密切联系
data.enText: an intimate connection between class and educational success

data.chText: 有性关系的；暧昧的

data.enText: or
having a sexual relationship with sb

data.chText: 密切关联 / 联系 / 相关
data.enText: intimately connected/linked/related

data.chText: 他十分熟悉的本国的一个地区
data.enText: an area of the country that he knew intimately

data.chText: 她已投入到这个项目中。
data.enText: She was intimately involved in the project.

data.chText: 他们相互爱抚。
data.enText: They touched each other intimately (= in a sexual way) .

data.chText: 透露；（间接）表示；暗示
data.enText: to let sb know what you think or mean in an indirect way

data.chText: 他已经向我们透露了他要退休的打算。
data.enText: He has already intimated to us his intention to retire.

data.chText: 他已经暗示他打算退休。
data.enText: He has already intimated (that) he intends to retire.

data.chText: 密友；至交；知己
data.enText: a close personal friend

simple_means.memory_skill: intim 内心的 + ate 有…性质的 → 亲密的

means: 个人隐私的(常指性方面的)

ex.chText: 她和所有邻居的关系都很好。
ex.enText: She is on familiar terms with all her neighbours.

ex.chText: 昨天晚上，他喝了几杯酒之后对那个女孩有点过分亲昵。
ex.enText: He was a bit too familiar with that girl after several drinks last night.

synonyms.bx: 指关系亲近的，也指某人的言行十分随便，显得过于亲昵的。

d: 友好的；过分亲密的，随便的

ex.enText: She and her younger sister are very close.

ex.chText: 篝火晚会之后，他觉得和苏珊更亲近了。
ex.enText: He felt closer to Susan after the campfire party.

synonyms.bx: 指人与人之间彼此喜爱、关系亲密的。

ex.chText: 他们已经在这里住了一年半了，却仍然和邻居不熟。
ex.enText: They have lived here for a year and a half, but are still not on intimate terms with their neighbours.

ex.chText: 她暗示她是整个计划的负责人。
ex.enText: She implied that she was the one in charge of the whole project.

synonyms.bx: 指间接表达自己的所感所想，而非直接说明。

ex.chText: 他强烈暗示他可能要竞选市长。
ex.enText: He strongly hinted that he might run for the position of mayor.

ex.chText: 她不知道她的朋友在暗示什么。
ex.enText: She had no idea what her friend was hinting at.

synonyms.bx: 指通过间接的言语或行动来暗示某事。

ex.chText: 他暗指那个男孩在对她说谎。
ex.enText: He insinuated that the boy was lying to her.

ex.chText: 你知道她想暗示什么吗？
ex.enText: Do you know what she was trying to insinuate?

synonyms.bx: 指暗示令人不愉快的内容，尤暗指某人不诚实。

ex.chText: 他向我暗示过他想辞职。
ex.enText: He has intimated to me his wish to resign.

ex.chText: 她含糊地暗示无法邀请他们参加聚会。
ex.enText: She vaguely intimated that she couldn't invite them to the party.

synonyms.bx: 指间接地表达出自己的意思，而非直接说明。

ex.chText: 你言下之意是说你比她聪明吗？
ex.enText: Are you suggesting that you are smarter than her?

ex.chText: 她根本不会有这样的意思。
ex.enText: She would never suggest such a thing.

synonyms.bx: 指隐晦而间接地表达某事。

tr: someone to whom private matters are confided

example: I insinuated that I did not like his wife
The evidence suggests a need for more clarification
pretending she is on an intimate footing with those she slanders

tr: marked by close acquaintance, association, or familiarity
example: intimate relations between economics, politics, and legal principles" - V.L. Parringto

tr: thoroughly acquainted through study or experience
example: this girl, so intimate with nature"-W.H.Hudso
knowledgeable about the technique of painting"- Herbert Rea

tr: having or fostering a warm or friendly and informal atmosphere
example: the small room was cozy and intimate
the internal contradictions of the theory
the intimate (or sexual) relations between husband and wife
she had been intimate with many men

value.boxr_value: The adjective and noun are pronounced  /'ɪntɪmət/. The verb is pronounced /'ɪntɪmeɪt/. 形容词读作 /'ɪntɪmət/,动词读作 /'ɪntɪmeɪt/。

value.def: If you have an intimate friendship with someone, you know them very well and like them a lot.

example.ex: I discussed with my intimate friends whether I would immediately have a baby.
example.tran: 我与密友们讨论是否我要马上生孩子。

example.ex: They are to have an autumn wedding, an intimate of the couple confides.
example.tran: 他们的婚礼将在秋季举行,这对情侣的一位密友透露说。

example.ex: He did not feel he had got to know them intimately.
example.tran: 他认为他没必要和他们密切来往。

value.def: If two people are in an intimate relationship, they are involved with each other in a loving or sexual way.

example.ex: I just won't discuss my intimate relationships.
example.tran: 我就是不想讨论我的恋爱关系。
她们与男友共浴爱河的时刻

value.tran: 有恋爱关系的;有性关系的

example.ex: You have to be willing to get to know yourself and your partner intimately.
example.tran: 你必须愿意在恋爱中逐渐认识自己和伴侣。

value.def: An intimate conversation or detail, for example, is very personal and private.

example.ex: He wrote about the intimate details of his family life...
example.tran: 他写到了关于他家庭生活的一些不为人知的细节。

example.ex: I hate to interrupt your intimate conversation but we do have an assignment to discuss.
example.tran: 我实在不愿打断你们的私人谈话,但是我们确实有事要谈。

example.ex: It was the first time they had attempted to talk intimately.
example.tran: 那是他们第一次试图私下交谈。

value.def: If you use intimate to describe an occasion or the atmosphere of a place, you like it because it is quiet and pleasant, and seems suitable for close conversations between friends.
An intimate connection between ideas or organizations, for example, is a very strong link between them.

example.ex: ...an intimate connection between madness and wisdom...
example.tran: 疯狂与智慧的密切关联

example.ex: France has kept the most intimate links with its former African territories.
example.tran: 法国与其前非洲属地一直保持着最密切的联系。

example.ex: Property and equities are intimately connected in Hong Kong.
example.tran: 在香港，房地产与证券密切关联。

value.def: An intimate knowledge of something is a deep and detailed knowledge of it.

example.ex: He surprised me with his intimate knowledge of Kierkegaard and Schopenhauer.
example.tran: 他对克尔恺郭尔与叔本华的深刻了解让我很吃惊。

example.ex: ...a golden age of musicians whose work she knew intimately.
example.tran: 其作品她耳熟能详的黄金一代的音乐家

value.def: If you intimate something, you say it in an indirect way.

example.ex: He went on to intimate that he was indeed contemplating a shake-up of the company...
example.tran: 他继续暗示他确实在考虑对公司进行一次大改组。

example.ex: He had intimated to the French and Russians his readiness to come to a settlement.
example.tran: 他已经向法国人和俄国人暗示他愿意达成协议。

partsOfSpeech.dec: intim 内心的 + acy 性质，状态，情况 → 内部关系 → 亲密
intim 内心的 + ate 有…性质的 → 亲密的
intimate 亲密的 + ly …地 → 密切地
